intro: Arisaema consanguineum f. alpestre, commonly known as the alpine arrowhead, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence composed of a spadix surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. The plant features broad, arrowhead-shaped leaves that are often hairy and adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow with a distinctive, fleshy spadix that bears tiny, inconspicuous flowers. This variant is distinguished by its more compact growth habit and smaller, more elongated leaves compared to the typical form of Arisaema consanguineum.
